data.title: Great place for a dose of culture in Wichita Falls!
data.text: We have enjoyed performances here for many years. Some of the shows can be a bit more "cutting edge" or "adult" than at our other wonderful community theater, but it is nice to have that option in our town.  The performers are so well rehearsed and the small size of the stages creates an intimacy between the audience and the actors. You can go to the dinner shows, or skip the dinner and arrive in time for the performance.  One of the best things this theater did was add the handicapped ramp a few years ago. That was a great help to the folks who cannot manage the steep stairs up to the main stage.  What an asset the Backdoor is to our community!

data.title: Escanaba in da Moonlight
data.text: The cast did the play very well. I was happy to see they even used Yooper accents and lost their Texas tongues. If this play comes back to Wichita Falls, I recommend all deer hunters  make a trip to the theater. This show written by Jeff Daniels is hilarious.

data.title: Fabulous
data.text: Wichita Falls has a jewel in the Back Door Theatre. I bought season tickets this year and have love it! The dinner Theatre is fun and you can meet new people if you share a table. The new seats are wonderful. A must see!

data.title: The Odd Couple
data.text: Great play on dinner stage! Most all shows r very well done! Concerned about becoming too liberal for area! We try to support the local arts & aback door has been a tradition for more than 40 years

data.title: Theatre's setting
data.text:
Theaters seating allow for great viewing and hearing from any place.
Actors portray characters exceptionally well and plays I've seen are well done.

data.title: Bring It On
data.text:
My family went to see Bring It On at the Backdoor Theatre on a Friday night.  We had a local girl from our small town in the play.  She, along with all the kids in the program, did phenomenal!  I was amazed at the talent of the kids that were in the Bring It On program.  The amount of hours they all had put in had really paid off.  No one missed a beat.  
The theatre is small, like 3 sections and maybe 4 or 5 rows in each section.  I wouldn't think you could have a bad seat.  Check in was a breeze and we were shown our seats quickly.  My only complaint...it was HOT! Like miserably hot in the theatre, and I am cold natured.  My whole family was sweating!  I know with the lighting in a small theatre it will be a bit warmer, and it was July in Texas, but this was bad!  I don't know if there were a/c issues or if that is the norm.  We couldn't wait to get to car and cool off.  Again, the show and the talent was AMAZING!

data.title: Good Local Entertainment
data.text: Backdoor Theater provides very good local entertainment to the local area.  It boasts some of the best acting of any theater that I have experienced!  They offer a great variety of shows that will entertain individuals as well as families!  Try it out!

data.title: We laughed alot!!!!
data.text: My wife and I went for an improve night and it was truly a riot. The actors were on point and extremely funny.  They provided set ups and it was byob.  There was also Stonehouse pizza to eat. We will be coming back.

data.title: patsy clines show
data.text: the upstairs theater in the round is an experience in itself. although the AC could use updating its very quaint and worth the money

data.title: Fun night at Backdoor
data.text: My husband and I went to see Always, Patsy Cline and it was a really good show.  The stage is visible from every seat and the sound was really great!  Elizabeth Spear was wonderful as Patsy Cline. The band was good! The tickets for the show itself were only $17 per person.   It was really fun.

data.title: Get me to the theater on time
data.text: My husband took me here for our anniversary.  It was the dinner theater and it was spectacular.  The meal was good.  The wait staff polite. The show was off the hook and up to back doors high standards.

data.title: Great Entertainment at Backdoor Theatre
data.text: Lots of talented people are involved in Backdoor Theatre. The building was originally an ice house and is located in historic downtown Wichita Falls.

data.title: A Great Night Out
data.text: This is a great place for entertainment.  I have been to several plays here, and each time I am always blown away by the talent that everyone has.  Some shows are shown in the dinner theater,  You can choose the dinner and show or show only. The dinners are always good.  It's a small production, but they are definitely worth checking out.  It' a good place to go to have a different experience and not do the same old thing.

data.title: Les Mis!
data.text: My daughter and I (she's a student at MSU) attended the theater on Friday night while I was up for a visit. It is a beautiful old building and any seat in the house would have been good. We really enjoyed the show.

data.title: Quirky delightful and unique fun: NYC in WF
data.text:
Yeah! It was our first trip to this lovely hidden gem downtown.  We were immediately greeted by friendly and welcoming volunteers who set the tone for a place to feel at home.  We did not eat, but the meal they served looked and smelled delicious.  I loved the size...not too big and not too small.  I also love the set up of tables.  The actual production was clever and fun.  I felt like I was in NYC sans the big city attitudes.  We got the benefit of entertainment without the attitude!  It is cozy and dark and looks like you can bring in your own wine.
I think it would be a good place for a date night, girl night out or special birthday with friends.  If you are tired of bad expensive movies with sticky floors but want to see an intelligent production, this is the answer!

data.title: Top Notch Dining and Entertainment!
data.text: If you are looking for a unique dining and/or entertainment experience, give the Backdoor Theatre a try! We attended "I'll Be Back Before Midnight" and "A 1940s Christmas Carol" as part of their dinner theater. We can't say enough of how much we enjoyed both performances. The meals were excellent and the servers were wonderful and very helpful. The plays themselves were a lot of fun, and it was wonderful seeing performers who poured their hearts into their work -- there is a lot of strong talent in Wichita Falls. We absolutely love Backdoor Theatre, and plan on seeing future performances. (Consider a trip to this dinner theatre for a unique birthday, anniversary or "just because" gift as well!)

data.title: Terrific local Theater
data.text: Husband and I attended the play, I'll be Back After Midnight.  It was well performed, and we enjoyed it with another couple who went with us.  The theater is small, cozy and the acoustics are excellent.  We were impressed enough to purchase tickets for our son's birthday present.  He and his wife also enjoyed the performance very much.  Highly recommended, fun.

data.title: Always GREAT!
data.text: Backdoor is wonderful. Wichita Falls has a strong community theater program. If you can catch a dinner theater production, that's wonderful, too.

data.title: Great production
data.text: I have not tried the dinner theater, but the expericence of the regular production was a good time had by all.

data.title: GREAT Entertainment
data.text: A great place to enjoy a play with the entire family.  They even offer a dinner show....very good and lots of fun!
